title: Top 9.5 Things Make a BETTER Worm Farmer

tasks.task: Managing worm bins and caring for African night crawlers.
subtasks: Limiting the number of worm bins to a manageable amount.
Watering the worm bins once a week.
Adding various food sources (e.g., meat, manure, paper, bedding, compost, vegetables) to the worm bins.
Observing the worms' activity and adjusting management practices accordingly.
Avoiding overfeeding the worms, especially meat which attracts flies.
Ensuring consistent moisture levels in the worm bins.
Incorporating soil amendments through the worm bins for gradual breakdown.
Adjusting feeding schedules based on food processing rates (e.g., cranberries taking 10 months to decompose).
Experimenting with grit in the worm bins and monitoring its impact.
Providing various enrichment (e.g., heating pad, vegetables) for the worms.
Balancing full-time employment and channel management for personal well-being.
Engaging with viewers through comments, playlists, and community-building efforts.
